title: Investigation into Fatal Houston Shooting at 8449 Gulf Freeway
content:
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
Investigation into Fatal Shooting at 8449 Gulf Freeway
Houston police are investigating the fatal shooting of one man and wounding of three other persons at 8449 Gulf Freeway about 7:05 a.m. on Sunday (Feb. 14).
The identity of the deceased male, 24, believed to be one of two suspects in this case, is pending verification by the Harris County Institute of Forensic Sciences. Three other wounded individuals - a male, 28, a female, 20, and a female, 27 - were transported to area hospitals with non-life threatening injuries.
HPD Homicide Division Officers K. Winningham and C. Liu reported:
A fight broke out between groups of females at an after hours club at the above address. The fight escalated in the parking lot where a group of males also began fighting. One male (suspect) went to his vehicle where he retrieved a gun, returned to the location and began firing his weapon into the crowd. At that time, a second male suspect, standing at an open door to the club, also fired shots into the crowd. The first male suspect was struck and was pronounced dead at an area hospital. Three other adults in the crowd were wounded and also taken to area hospitals. The second suspect, described only as a Hispanic male, fled the scene.
Investigators are asking anyone with information or an identity on the second suspect to contact the HPD Homicide Division at 713-308-3600 or Crime Stoppers at 713-222-TIPS.
JFC/VHS 2-15-16
Inc #019589816
